Uses of Class
pulse.problem.statements.Problem

  • Packages that use Problem 
    Package Description
    pulse
    Contains some of the most frequently used classes, which did not seem to fit in any other packages.
    pulse.problem.schemes
    This package deals with anything associated with finite differences in PULsE, including the definition of Grids, which define the partitioning rules for space and time variables, the discretised Pulse on any of those grids, and finite-difference schemes, which subclass DifferenceScheme.
    pulse.problem.statements
    Introduces various problem statements for the heat conduction problem in the laser flash experiment.
    pulse.tasks
    Introduces the SearchTask, which is the main actor in PULsE, and the TaskManager, a high-level class which among other functions manages loading and executing SearchTasks.

    • Uses of Problem in pulse

      Methods in pulse with parameters of type Problem 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static HeatingCurve HeatingCurve.classicSolution​(Problem p)
      Calculates the classic solution, using the default value of the precision and the time limit specified by the HeatingCurve of p.
      static HeatingCurve HeatingCurve.classicSolution​(Problem p, double timeLimit)  
      static HeatingCurve HeatingCurve.classicSolution​(Problem p, double timeLimit, int precision)
      A static factory method for calculating a heating curve based on the analytical solution of Parker et al.

      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  DiathermicMaterialProblem  
      class  LinearisedProblem
      The simplest problem statement supported in PULsE, which is formulated in the dimensionless form and with linearised boundary conditions.

      Methods in pulse.tasks with parameters of type Problem 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void SearchTask.setProblem​(Problem problem)
      After setting and adopting the problem by this SearchTask, this will attempt to change the parameters of that problem in accordance with the loaded ExperimentalData for this SearchTask (if not null).
